Approach

Because there were no restriction on what technologies I should use (i.e. plain css, flexbox, CSS Grid, or libraries like bootstrap etc.) I looked at the Inxeption website and it seems that flexbox is being used so I will use that. I will also use SASS pre-processor since it helps with developing the css and makes it more legible

Approach

This is a closure issue, there are actually 2 ways to solve this. The nice Es6 way, or using function scoping to ensure that each button will log the correct value at the time that it was ran

Using functional scope

              
                var buttons = document.querySelectorAll('button'); 
                
                function showNum(node , num) { 
                    node.addEventListener('click', function(e) { 
                        console.log('clicked on ', num) 
                    }) 
                } 
                for (var i = 0; i < buttons.length; i++) { 
                    showNum(buttons[i], i); 
                }

Using Es6 let variables

            
                var buttons = document.querySelectorAll('button'); 
                
                for (let i = 0; i < buttons.length; i++) {
                    buttons[i].addEventListener('click', function () { 
                        console.log('clicked on ', i);
                    });
                }
